subject: Optimization of Planning & Execution Process of NHAI Projects- reg.
text: #T 77ty <THTf xfearut 894 Phone 01-11-25074100/25074200 (s85 watt att {aranf KaaT) Fax 91-41-25033507 25033514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) #-5 va 6, 4727-10, ara5t, 38 Raeh-+10075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Dethi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Timelines for NHAI Projects /2017 No.18.22/2017, Dated the July, 2017 (Decision taken on File No.NHAl/11013/SRDAQ/PMIS/2017) Sub: Optimization of Planning & Execution Process of NHAI Projects Infrastructure growth plays a major role in driving the economy of a country and development of road sector is an integral of it; Therefore; with an objective to set and achieve higher targets for award and construction of NH projects every year , the timelines   required for various activities have been deliberated at this HQ and following decisions have been taken: (i) The time period for each activity in the planning execution process of NH projects has been firmed up in order to optimize the project delivery mechanism ji) The evaluations of DPR bids shall be done using tools available on INFRACON Portal. The period of evaluation of bids for DPR which is presently 45 will, therefore, be curtailed to about 20 (iii) The various clearances required from MoEGF Railway and Irrigation Departments take longer time SO the process of obtaining clearances must commence as soon as the alignment is finalized and Final Feasibility Report (FFR) is submitted. (iv) It has been observed that the estimates for shifting utilities are, at times, finalized on lumpsum basis. Correctly worked out utility estimates be obtained with due   diligence at the earliest after the alignment finalization and shall form of appraisal proposal. The process of project appraisal should commence at the earliest on receipt of the Final Detailed Project Report (DPR) and Technical Schedules. The bids should be invited as soon as the proposal is submitted for appraisal: However, the bids shall be received only after approval of the work from the competent authority. (vi) The period of construction shall be decided judiciously keeping in view the nature, scope of work etc. As a guideline} the period of construction for highway projects upto 50 Km length shall be within 24 months. However , for the project lengths beyond 50 Km or specialized projects requiring construction of tunnels etc.>_ the construction period may be decided on case to case basis.
